document.title: Ohio Learning Standards English Language Arts

0B17EFBBFC2D49EDA32F8B3BA7BE6E98.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

500FF794235249F88655418E0808DFF3.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

D509470B608445418B716CC27098C90D.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

0AC3E8AD763046F881E657B6B2AD1149.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their antonyms (opposites).

711A5EFF83614C1A8608A4B1957CEA56.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

50014959204E470F9A65C9C3ACEA5CF2.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

634E88B2188145EB84AF0D9BFD305EB7.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

C19A66B5ED2140B99BAF3B2892ED5774.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

5E39829B189741E8B9DF56C281110918.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

281A986219364DF28FE1FFF66453B69B.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

98BF4581E31F4B3BA77351EC29AADA3E.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel phonemes (sounds).

E289252C4A6A4426A909BA80442AA24B.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

A938F147F91E4B4283B4E1C6CC899BEC.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

61D7551B74E04867A2E94D3F8D57F840.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

B906D788115647A0BC4C9D69DDF87185.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

E928B781865A42F6B02FC4395D40A313.description: Understand and use interrogatives (question words) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

F75AD2E54EFE4F83B97ED80C793C24BD.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding/s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

59CE4F2E8D194FBE995F841EAD6389D1.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

9EB4EC56C732406FA207B81C46B86A20.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

07FE0CB974214A8B9AEAB323292F868E.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

DE599A829E604194A7AA844A848FB536.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

9D2FE27AA96041DB8372C7D5D916E7F4.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

BEFAC7639E994F0BBAAF1562C93C6CAF.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

A26D8EC5400A449D8CE8F02B42DB8EC2.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

10744B77995644A286C6745418621A9B.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented in various media and other formats (e.g., orally) by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

C4EA1FA9A0F04A4499DF29BEBD2B84A0.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

D77395AE16584BE9A9367C71A7C629F2.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions(e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

7457BE47AE824F0B933FA837CB0D50A5.description: Participate in collaborative conversations about kindergarten topics and texts with diverse partners in small and larger groups.

1C2D8E6E9016462E987F5AE00C7C6EC7.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

16B6B6AF5F6240C0856CCB94A4803142.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

C2D7312D132C498D9F2DAAE4854F5BA0.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B81B1FAAE3224526AA02532A564F05DF.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

C69D790D69574ACABAB6CAB26CAC56AA.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

C1AC34F5A4104AA5BF563AD626605C79.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

A2B8AAB4F479430D8D146EE5CD6FBC55.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts that name what is being written about and supply some information about the topic.

3D652F9001EC446589DC002C4121EB98.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces that tell a reader the topic or the name of the book being written about and express an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

7581D2301F91492CBBC93F5951A31A67.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

61CB4287DD4E472D897519C8C29CD0E0.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

2AA31C2A91214F608B54CB9AFAFE82DB.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

C538B7FBBEC948538B11E1D1E478AABD.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

4BB617F5DAAD4D46B396284369A55C06.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one grapheme (letter)-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

3D0084B6C18549F59C1BDBC6CB92A697.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

2A6381225721422897D5699426A4EA9E.description: Add or substitute individual phonemes (sounds) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

0E76A17EB84D49BA89BBFDFDA2200F72.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final phonemes (sounds) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

4FCB1FF424C94E39808E0FEAADD11A73.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

F1FF89BD03F84654A42E8F312F44A255.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

5EAFC42D5DB647E9857AB7FD2A54B7E5.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and phonemes (sounds).

544E8970D2A44E7DAFD19980373DC14F.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

CB5CB997AE834382B83B6B20083D005A.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

F298C70053AD4EE79C260DAA6107D795.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

CBA379C3C63848B8999E1BBD1D515FD1.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

2FF9F27E5F514ADDB3BA17C5CAF134CB.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

8417BB52D0C64E178A53E44D584EA5C2.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

F8E18BCC990A450C847F4EC1C2244DCE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

872BA88099FD4ED79BED70780F0F1D30.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

B44E0D5ACC884E459BD4191321F38FDF.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

170482812DAA44808EEF7FED7587A232.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

7EC61B36722A41D9851C58CD9ABBF3A9.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

EEF90A5E36E945C2BC3DBC66817BB28A.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

11292F35602547A9AF3716E77A8E8CD1.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

AE4444A771674AAEB84564593BD55466.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

B98E3156D52547A48C0C85796E689CAD.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

854ABDAA6D0647DD9D4BB0776846FF05.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

9FFEA8CE25D444F69480B2D2D809611D.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding. Activate prior knowledge and draw on previous experiences in order to make text-to-self or text-to-text connections and comparisons.

8500317949764F2DA12E40D32EBE00D8.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9BC14E45FCE743C99F5BD941EAE90A10.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

A2AB7F932B5340578F8F27E8E271FA07.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

93E23B562D4C43E1B4ECBA00A0F832C6.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

C172ED2F3A28465EA48E36C5FF069E98.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

AA78F80227F345459305369DF74711B0.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

F7E8F76511EC46B88C9CA608C2460A82.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

298380477253472B93797A60F2F682F6.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

325442CA21B94864964C327E5CD4DBC5.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
